intro: Sphenogyne anethifolia, commonly known as the anise-leaved sphenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves emit a strong, spicy scent reminiscent of anise, contributing to its common name. Sphenogyne anethifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
